intro: Bladhia crenata f. xanthocarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited bladhia, is a rare horticultural form of the species Bladhia crenata. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange fruits, which contrast with its typical green or red-fruited variants. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It typically grows as a shrub with simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts for its unique fruit coloration.
